00021 template <  class T1,
00022           class T2,
00023           class T3,
00024           class T4,
00025           class T5,
00026           class T6
00027 >
00028 struct tuple_base
00029 {
00030     typedef T1 first_type;
00031     typedef T2 second_type;
00032     typedef T3 third_type;
00033     typedef T4 fourth_type;
00034     typedef T5 fifth_type;
00035     typedef T6 sixth_type;
00036 
00037     template <int I>
00038     struct item_type
00039     {/*
00040         typedef typename SWITCH<I, CASE<1,first_type,
00041                                 CASE<2,second_type,
00042                                 CASE<3,third_type,
00043                                 CASE<4,fourth_type,
00044                                 CASE<5,fifth_type,
00045                                 CASE<6,sixth_type,
00046                                 CASE<DEFAULT,void
00047                             > > > > > > > >::result result;*/
00048     };
00049 };

00051 
00055 template <  class T1,
00056           class T2 = Plug,
00057           class T3 = Plug,
00058           class T4 = Plug,
00059           class T5 = Plug,
00060           class T6 = Plug
00061 >
00062 struct tuple
00063 {
00064     typedef T1 first_type;
00065     typedef T2 second_type;
00066     typedef T3 third_type;
00067     typedef T4 fourth_type;
00068     typedef T5 fifth_type;
00069     typedef T6 sixth_type;
00070 
00071     template <int I>
00072     struct item_type
00073     {
00074         typedef typename SWITCH < I, CASE < 1, first_type,
00075         CASE < 2, second_type,
00076         CASE < 3, third_type,
00077         CASE < 4, fourth_type,
00078         CASE < 5, fifth_type,
00079         CASE < 6, sixth_type,
00080         CASE<DEFAULT, void
00081         > > > > > > > > ::result result;
00082     };
00083 
00085     first_type first;
00087     second_type second;
00089     third_type third;
00091     fourth_type fourth;
00093     fifth_type fifth;
00095     sixth_type sixth;
00096 
00097     tuple() { }
00098     tuple(  first_type fir,
00099             second_type sec,
00100             third_type thi,
00101             fourth_type fou,
00102             fifth_type fif,
00103             sixth_type six
00104     ) :
00105         first(fir),
00106         second(sec),
00107         third(thi),
00108         fourth(fou),
00109         fifth(fif),
00110         sixth(six)
00111     { }
00112 };
00113 
00115 template <class T1>
00116 struct tuple<T1, Plug, Plug, Plug, Plug>
00117 {
00118     typedef T1 first_type;
00119 
00120     first_type first;
00121 
00122     template <int I>
00123     struct item_type
00124     {
00125         typedef typename IF < I == 1, first_type, void > ::result result;
00126     };
00127 
00128     tuple() { }
00129     tuple(first_type fi) :
00130         first(fi)
00131     { }
00132 };
00133 
00135 template <class T1, class T2>
00136 struct tuple<T1, T2, Plug, Plug, Plug, Plug>
00137 {
00138     typedef T1 first_type;
00139     typedef T2 second_type;
00140 
00141     template <int I>
00142     struct item_type
00143     {
00144         typedef typename SWITCH < I, CASE < 1, first_type,
00145         CASE < 2, second_type,
00146         CASE<DEFAULT, void >
00147         > > > ::result result;
00148     };
00149 
00150     first_type first;
00151     second_type second;
00152 
00153     tuple() { }
00154     tuple(  first_type fi,
00155             second_type se
00156     ) :
00157         first(fi),
00158         second(se)
00159     { }
00160 };

00267         CASE<DEFAULT, void
